subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In Taiwan and Hong Kong, this character and its derived characters are written with {{l|mul|𦥑}} (7 strokes) as the upper component while in {{w|zh:新字形|mainland China}}, this character and its derivatives are written with {{l|mul|臼}} (6 strokes) as the upper component. * A {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs|CJK compatibility ideograph}} exists at U+2F837''(composition: {{l|mul|⿱[[申]][[又]]}})'' and is encoded for a historical variant found in the Ming dynasty dictionary 《重訂直音篇》.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: * U+53DF {{Han char|rn=29|rad=又|as=08|asc=07|sn=10|snc=9|four=77407|canj=HXLE|ids=⿱⿻臼丨又(G),⿱⿻𦥑丨又(HTJK)}} * U+2F837 {{Han char|rn=29|rad=又|as=05|sn=7|four=|canj=LLE|ids=⿱申又}}
